maml:description.maml:para: Gets environment-related deployment variables from a location containing deployment variables.
This is the Description section
Specifies the location of the deployment variables to retrieve.
Specifies a script to run for each configuration variable.

Variable processing occurs prior to resolving environment-level variables into application-level variables so the specified script can adjust variable data (Name, Value) as necessary before the variables are merged and before the variables are converted to a hashtable (if -AsHashtable) is specified.
The script must return the variable that is pass into it or the variable will not be outputted from the command.
Specifies the location of the deployment variables to retrieve.

Specifies the name of the environment into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how the variables will be resolved from environment level to application level.

Specifies the name of the computer into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how computer-specific overrides are applied.
Specifies a script to run for each configuration variable.

Variable processing occurs prior to resolving environment-level variables into application-level variables so the specified script can adjust variable data (Name, Value) as necessary before the variables are merged and before the variables are converted to a hashtable (if -AsHashtable) is specified.
The script must return the variable that is pass into it or the variable will not be outputted from the command.
Specifies the location of the deployment variables to retrieve.

Specifies the name of the environment into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how the variables will be resolved from environment level to application level.

Specifies the name of the computer into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how computer-specific overrides are applied.
Specifies a script to run for each configuration variable.

Variable processing occurs prior to resolving environment-level variables into application-level variables so the specified script can adjust variable data (Name, Value) as necessary before the variables are merged and before the variables are converted to a hashtable (if -AsHashtable) is specified.
The script must return the variable that is pass into it or the variable will not be outputted from the command.
Specifies the location of the deployment variables to retrieve.

Specifies the name of the environment into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how the variables will be resolved from environment level to application level.

Specifies the name of the computer into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how computer-specific overrides are applied.
Specifies a script to run for each configuration variable.

Variable processing occurs prior to resolving environment-level variables into application-level variables so the specified script can adjust variable data (Name, Value) as necessary before the variables are merged and before the variables are converted to a hashtable (if -AsHashtable) is specified.
The script must return the variable that is pass into it or the variable will not be outputted from the command.
Specifies the location of the deployment variables to retrieve.
Specifies a script to run for each configuration variable.

Variable processing occurs prior to resolving environment-level variables into application-level variables so the specified script can adjust variable data (Name, Value) as necessary before the variables are merged and before the variables are converted to a hashtable (if -AsHashtable) is specified.
The script must return the variable that is pass into it or the variable will not be outputted from the command.

Specifies the name of the environment into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how the variables will be resolved from environment level to application level.

Specifies the name of the computer into which the package is being deployed. This value will determine which configuration variables are returned (acting as a filter) and how computer-specific overrides are applied.
This is the Description section
Specifies a command to run on the target computer after package installation completes. Enclose the commands in braces ( { } ) to create a script block.
Specifies a command to run on the target computer after package installation completes. Enclose the commands in braces ( { } ) to create a script block.
Deploys a package to a computer.

The Invoke-Powerdeploy cmdlet executes the first phase of a Powerdeploy deployment which includes transmission of the Powerdeploy package and the Powerdeploy module and support files to the target computer followed by remote execution of the Install-DeploymentPackage cmdlet on the target computer to install the package.
Specifies the path to the Powerdeploy package to be deployed.

The package must have a valid package name of the format <package-id>_<package-version>.zip (ex: MyWebApplication_1.2.3.zip). The package name can optionally start with a 'PD_' prefix (ex: PD_MyWebApplication_1.2.3.zip).

The name of the environment into which the package is being deployed. This value does not change the behavior of Powerdeploy but is used to determine which variables to use during deployment and is made available to custom scripts and conventions.
Unused.
Specifies the name of the computer to which the package will be deployed.
Specifies the user account that has permission to connect to the target computer and install packages. The default is the current user.
Specifies the directory where the package will be extracted on the target computer. The default is a temporary file location.
This value is available to post install scripts (see -PostInstallScript) using the $PowerdeployDeploymentParameters.DeployedFolderPath property.
Specifies name value pairs to include as deployment variables made available to conventions and custom deployment scripts.
Specifies the command to run on the target computer after package installation completes. Enclose the commands in braces ( { } ) to create a script block.
Any variables in the command are evaluated on the remote computer.
Specifies the path to the Powerdeploy package to be deployed.

The package must have a valid package name of the format <package-id>_<package-version>.zip (ex: MyWebApplication_1.2.3.zip). The package name can optionally start with a 'PD_' prefix (ex: PD_MyWebApplication_1.2.3.zip).

The name of the environment into which the package is being deployed. This value does not change the behavior of Powerdeploy but is used to determine which variables to use during deployment and is made available to custom scripts and conventions.
Unused.
Specifies the name of the computer to which the package will be deployed.
Specifies the user account that has permission to connect to the target computer and install packages. The default is the current user.
Specifies the directory where the package will be extracted on the target computer. The default is a temporary file location.
This value is available to post install scripts (see -PostInstallScript) using the $PowerdeployDeploymentParameters.DeployedFolderPath property.
Specifies name value pairs to include as deployment variables made available to conventions and custom deployment scripts.
Specifies the command to run on the target computer after package installation completes. Enclose the commands in braces ( { } ) to create a script block.
Any variables in the command are evaluated on the remote computer.
Resolves the value of deployment variables for a specific deployment.
This is the Description section
Resolves the variables represented by the specified deployment variables. Enter a variable that contains the objects, or type a command or expression that gets the objects.
Resolves variables given a deployment to the specified environment.
Resolves variables given a deployment to the specified computer.
Outputs resolved values as a hashtable rather than an array of objects.
